Resident Evil Code Veronica Remake release date and platforms

Resident Evil Code Veronica is all set to receive a remake, and the same is already in development. There have already been loads of rumors and insider talks about the title, and it will be exciting to see the modernized version.The game essentially acts as the bridge between the Raccoon City era and the global bio-terror of later games, making it an important part of the storyline. Accordingly, the Resident Evil Code Veronica Remake is going to be one of the essential remakes for the series.Here are all the details about the Resident Evil Code Veronica RemakeWhile Capcom has not yet locked in a definitive release date for the Resident Evil Code Veronica Remake, the production timeline suggests a launch window of 2027 . This follows the expected release of Resident Evil Requiem (RE9), which is all set to arrive in February 2026.In terms of platforms, the game is likely going to be developed for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC. Further specifics regarding the Resident Evil Code Veronica Remake will mostly be released throughout 2026.The original Resident Evil Code Veronica was famous for its high difficulty and sometimes punishing resource management.You can expect the remake to adopt the over-the-shoulder third-person camera that has become the standard for the series since the Resident Evil 2 remake.The RE Engine will provide a massive visual overhaul, turning the environments into photorealistic nightmares. Besides this, there will obviously be gameplay improvements, which will include modernized combat, seamless transitions between areas (eliminating the classic door-loading screens), and refined inventory management.Lastly, the dual-character mechanic, i.e., alternating between siblings Claire and Chris Redfield, will mostly be expanded to feel more interconnected.Speaking of the story, the remake will primarily follow Claire Redfield as she searches for her brother, Chris, which results in her going to the Umbrella prison facility on Rockfort Island. You will once again face the Ashford twins, Alfred and Alexia, who are quite terrifying.Capcom will potentially add new documents and cutscenes that tie the Ashford family to the origins of the Megamycete or other series-wide biological threats. With the return of the iconic villain Albert Wesker, the Resident Evil Code Veronica Remake is the golden opportunity to refine his abilities and the rivalry with the Redfields.This was all the known information about the Resident Evil Code Veronica Remake, and further specifics of the game will be revealed mostly after Resident Evil Requiem gets released on February 27, 2026.

Mark Cuban advice young engineers to not go behind big companies

The state of AI adoption





American billionaire and entrepreneur Mark Cuban has now urged the young engineers entering the job market to prioritise small and medium-sized companies over multinational corporations (MNCs) when seeking opportunities in artificial intelligence (AI). Cuban feels that smaller companies offer better platform for new graduates to make an immediate impact, while large corporations often dilute individual contributions.Speaking in an interview with CNBC and on his podcast The Dumbest Guy in the Room, Cuban explained that smaller companies are mainly entrepreneur-driven and they lack the deep IT departments or larger corporations. This gap creates opportunities for fresh graduates which directly contribute to the AI projects.‚ÄúSmall- to medium-size companies don‚Äôt have that depth. They are typically entrepreneurially driven and don‚Äôt have the flexibility to have people research things. Bringing a new graduate on to work on agentic AI projects is inexpensive for them and can get them immediate results,‚Äù Cuban said.Cuban also used the example of his own company, Cost Plus Drugs, noting how AI can automate processes to boost productivity, competitiveness, and profitability.Cuban argued that in big organisations, AI skills may not stand out as they are common among thousands of IT employees. On the other hand, in smaller firms often lack such expertise, making new graduates with AI knowledge invaluable. He also compared the present wave of AI with early days of the internet, when young engineers were hired to implement new technologies because they were more comfortable with them than older executives.Cuban also highlighted that 95% of companies have not yet seen measurable revenue returns from AI investments. The exceptions, he said, are mostly early-stage startups led by young entrepreneurs who design their processes around AI models tailored to their businesses.He urged his children and other young people to learn as much as possible about AI, stressing that companies are still grappling with how to use the technology for competitive advantage.
Article Summary: Mark Cuban has urged young engineers to prioritise small and medium-sized companies over multinational corporations (MNCs) when seeking opportunities in artificial intelligence. Article Title: Microsoft: Tech Layoffs: Layoffs at Microsoft, Meta, Google, Twitter: What is 'career cushioning' and why it's important
Article Text:
As job cuts continue to rise in various industries, some employees are going for 'career cushioning'.

Q: What is career cushioning?

Q: Why is career cushioning important?

Q: How can I start career cushioning?

Q: What are some examples of career cushioning?

Q: Is career cushioning only for people in certain industries?

Q: How often should I review and update my career cushioning efforts?

Q: How do I know if my career cushioning efforts are working?

Q: How much time should I be dedicating to career cushioning?

NEW DELHI: Microsoft Corp is reportedly planning to cut thousands of jobs, with some roles expected to be eliminated in the human resources and engineering divisions, according to media reports on Tuesday.This move follows similar job cuts announced by other tech companies, such as Amazon, Meta Platforms , Twitter, Google , Salesforce and a host of other corporations.These job cuts are being attributed to slowing demand and a worsening global economic outlook. The move by Microsoft indicates that the tech sector may continue to shed jobs in the coming months.As job cuts continue to rise in tech and various other industries, some employees are choosing to proactively seek out new job opportunities while still employed. This strategy, referred to as " career cushioning ". Here is all you need to know on 'career cushioning'A: Career cushioning refers to the practice of building a diverse set of skills and experiences in order to make oneself more marketable and resilient to job loss or industry changes. This can include gaining experience in multiple areas of a field, developing a side hustle or passion project, or building a professional network.A: Career cushioning can help provide a sense of security and confidence in uncertain job markets and can also open up new opportunities for career advancement. It can also help you be better prepared if you do lose your job, making it easier to find new employment.A: There are several ways to begin career cushioning, such as:Building a diverse skill set through continuing education or volunteer workNetworking with professionals in your industry and other industriesBuilding a personal brand through social media and professional online presenceSaving money for unexpected career changes or job loss.A: Some examples of career cushioning include:-A software developer taking on freelance web design projects to gain experience in user interface design.-A marketing professional starting a blog to gain experience in content creation.-A sales representative taking on additional responsibilities in product development to gain experience in product management.A: No, career cushioning is applicable for people in any industry. It's about being proactive in preparing for potential changes in your career, regardless of the industry you're in.A: It's a good idea to review your career cushioning efforts regularly, perhaps once or twice a year. This will allow you to assess your progress and make any necessary adjustments to your plans. Additionally, keeping an eye on the job market and industry trends can help you anticipate and prepare for any potential changes in your field.A: You can gauge the effectiveness of your career cushioning efforts by monitoring your progress in gaining new skills and experiences, as well as the feedback you receive from your professional network and potential employers. Additionally, you may find that you are better able to adapt to changes in your industry, or that you have more opportunities available to you.A: The amount of time you should dedicate to career cushioning will depend on your individual goals and circumstances, however it's important to balance the time you spend career cushioning with your other responsibilities. A good rule of thumb is to spend some time each week or month working on career cushioning activities, but not to the point that it negatively impacts other areas of your life.
Article Summary: As job cuts continue to rise in various industries, some employees are going for 'career cushioning' Career cushioning refers to the practice of building a diverse set of skills and experiences in order to make oneself more marketable. This can include gaining experience in multiple areas of a field, developing a side hustle or passion project, or building a professional network.

Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella is shaking up how the tech giant approaches artificial intelligence with an unconventional leadership strategy: keeping executives out of the room. The CEO has launched a weekly AI accelerator meeting that deliberately excludes senior managers from presenting, instead giving the floor to lower-level technical employees working directly on AI projects.According to internal memos obtained by Business Insider, Nadella created the new meeting format along with a corresponding Teams channel to speed up AI development and gather unfiltered insights from across the company. The approach is intentionally "messy and chaotic," designed to avoid top-down AI leadership and get real-time feedback from engineers in the trenches.The move reflects Nadella's view that AI represents both an existential threat and a once-in-a-generation opportunity for Microsoft. He's pushing the company to operate with unprecedented "intensity and urgency," according to Business Insider sources familiar with the matter.This grassroots meeting structure is part of broader organizational shifts at Microsoft. Nadella recently promoted sales chief Judson Althoff to CEO of commercial business, freeing up his own time to focus on technical AI work. In internal messages to corporate vice presidents, Nadella urged leaders to "work and act like ICs" (individual contributors) rather than traditional managers."We all have to work and act like ICs in our own orgs, constantly learning and unlearning," Nadella wrote in a Teams channel for executives, Business Insider reported.The CEO is also having direct conversations with executives about whether they're willing to commit to the "mountain of work" required for Microsoft's AI transformation‚Äîor leave. "You've gotta be asking yourself how much longer you want to do this," one Microsoft executive told Business Insider.Nadella has shifted his language from saying Microsoft is in the "early innings" to the "middle innings" of AI, signaling his determination to see the transformation through to completion.
Article Summary: Satya Nadella has launched a weekly AI accelerator meeting that deliberately excludes senior managers from presenting. Residents of Saudi Arabia ‚Äôs Eastern Province experienced an unexpected start to their Wednesday morning as a moderate earthquake rippled through the region, briefly unsettling communities while remaining under close monitoring by authorities. The tremor was felt across several areas, prompting residents to share their experiences online, while official monitoring agencies confirmed that no immediate damage or injuries were reported.In the early hours of Wednesday, December 17, 2025, a 4.3-magnitude earthquake shook the Eastern Province of Saudi Arabia. The tremor was recorded at 2:11 am (UAE time) at a depth of about 50 kilometers beneath the surface, according to the National Centre of Meteorology (NCM) of the UAE and seismic data from Saudi authorities.Seismologists describe this level of earthquake as moderate, strong enough to be measured clearly by instruments but unlikely to cause significant damage at the surface.The quake‚Äôs epicenter was in Saudi Arabia‚Äôs Eastern Province, a region that sits near the Arabian Gulf. While Saudi Arabia isn‚Äôt commonly thought of as a hotbed of seismic activity, the Arabian Plate and adjacent fault systems are geologically active, making smaller tremors a routine scientific observation.Past quakes of similar strengths, including earlier 4.3-magnitude events detected offshore near Jubail, have been tracked by monitoring networks without causing harm.Experts explain that these events often reflect the slow movement of tectonic plates, such as the Arabian Plate pushing against neighboring plates like the Eurasian Plate. This stress occasionally releases as minor tremors across the wider Gulf region.Despite the 4.3 magnitude, which is classified as a "light" to "moderate" earthquake, authorities have been quick to reassure the public. The Saudi Geological Survey (SGS) and regional weather centers confirmed that:While Saudi Arabia isn‚Äôt typically known for frequent major earthquakes, the region does experience occasional seismic activity, particularly along its fault lines in the Red Sea and near the Arabian Gulf.Experts from the Saudi Geological Survey emphasize that the National Seismic Monitoring Network is constantly active, tracking every minor shift in the earth's crust. This network provides real-time data to ensure that any potential threats are identified and communicated to the public instantly.Understanding the science behind small tremors helps communities stay informed without unnecessary alarm.This midnight event marks the fourth notable seismic occurrence within the Kingdom or its immediate coastal waters this year. This series of minor quakes highlights the ongoing tectonic adjustments in the region:Geologists explain that these frequent but minor events are often caused by the Arabian Tectonic Plate slowly colliding with the Eurasian Plate. Rather than a cause for alarm, experts see these as natural "pressure releases" that prevent the buildup of much larger, more destructive energy.For those living in the Eastern Province, this event serves as a gentle reminder of nature‚Äôs power. Geologists suggest that small tremors like these are often just the earth releasing built-up pressure in a safe, non-destructive way. As of now, the situation is entirely stable, and daily life continues as normal across the Kingdom.
Article Summary: A 4.3-magnitude earthquake shook the Eastern Province of Saudi Arabia. The tremor was recorded at 2:11 am (UAE time) at a depth of about 50 kilometers beneath the surface. The epicenter was in Saudi Arabia‚Äôs Eastern Province, which sits near the Arabian Gulf.

Article Title: Ask Dhirendra: 'How do I decide how much to save and invest when my income is just about enough?'
Article Text:
The problem is not which fund to choose. It‚Äôs how much they can realistically save. (AI image)

‚ÄúHow do I decide how much to save and invest when my income is just about enough?‚Äù

What can you save today without breaking your life? How can you make that number grow every year?

Where does a typical salary go?

Some expenses are non-negotiable (rent, basic food, fees).

Some are negotiable but important (a modest phone, occasional eating out).

Some are pure leakage (unused subscriptions, impulsive orders, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt even remember what this was‚Äù).

From spare change to serious money

Step up your SIP before you step up your lifestyle

First, add up your genuine essentials: rent/EMI, groceries, utilities, fees, basic transport.

Next, be realistic and add a modest amount for discretionary spending that you know you‚Äôll do anyway ‚Äì because you are human, not a robot.

See what is left. From that leftover, commit to a percentage ‚Äì even 10% of your take-home income ‚Äì as a non-negotiable saving and investing amount. Set up automatic transfers and SIPs for that right after your salary date.

If you have any queries for Dhirendra Kumar you can drop us an email at: toi.business@timesinternet.in

(Dhirendra Kumar is Founder and CEO of Value Research)

This is one of those questions that sounds technical, but is actually very emotional.On paper, it‚Äôs simple: income comes in, expenses go out, and whatever is left is ‚Äúsavings. In real life, income comes in, rent, EMIs, school fees, petrol, Swiggy, Zomato, sale on Myntra, birthday gifts, one sudden expense‚Ä¶ and at the end of the month, you look at your balance and say, ‚ÄúI‚Äôll start investing from next month. Pakka.‚ÄùNext month looks surprisingly similar.So let‚Äôs start with an honest admission: for most people, the problem is not which fund to choose. It‚Äôs how much they can realistically save when it feels like the money is just about enough.At Value Research, whenever we look at this, we don‚Äôt begin with a number like ‚Äúyou must save 30%‚Äù. We start with a different idea: savings are not what is left after spending. Savings are what you decide first; spending adjusts after that if you flip this order, the maths ‚Äì and your behaviour ‚Äì changes completely.A good rule of thumb for many middle-class households is to allocate 20‚Äì30% of their take-home income to savings and investments. However, I also know that for many people today, 30% sounds like a bad joke. So instead of fighting over the ‚Äúideal‚Äù number, let‚Äôs work with two simpler questions:To answer the first question, you need to know where your money is actually going, not where you think it is going.For one or two months, track your expenses honestly ‚Äì not for Instagram, for yourself. You don‚Äôt need an app; even a simple notebook or spreadsheet works.Once you see your own pie chart, three things usually stand out:Your first ‚Äúinvestment‚Äù might simply be plugging two or three leaks. Even if that frees up only ‚Çπ2,000‚Äì‚Çπ3,000 a month, that is your starting SIP.Now let‚Äôs look at how ‚Äúsmall‚Äù that really is.When we run these numbers at Value Research in our retirement and goal calculators, the results are always the same: the gap between zero and small is far bigger than the gap between small and perfect.But what if your income truly is at the survival stage? There are people for whom even ‚Çπ2,000 is a luxury some months. If that‚Äôs your reality, you have two parallel jobs. One is to create a tiny habit ‚Äì even ‚Çπ500 or ‚Çπ1,000 a month into a recurring deposit or a conservative fund. The absolute amount is less important than the mental switch from ‚ÄúI‚Äôll save if anything is left‚Äù to ‚ÄúI will save something, and then I will live on the rest. ‚ÄùThe second job is to make sure that as your income grows, your lifestyle doesn‚Äôt expand at the same speed. This is where a lot of middle-class Indians quietly sabotage themselves. Every salary increase automatically becomes a better phone, nicer meals out, upgraded gadgets, and bigger car loans. The percentage saved stays the same, or sometimes even falls.A very powerful habit ‚Äì one we often build into plans at Value Research ‚Äì is the ‚Äústep-up‚Äù. Each year, when your salary goes up, you increase your SIPs and savings before you upgrade anything else.In many examples we‚Äôve run, the step-up strategy leads to a dramatically higher corpus at the end, without you ever feeling an acute ‚Äúsacrifice‚Äù in any single year. You just avoid letting every pay hike leak out into lifestyle.Now, how do you decide your own number?Here‚Äôs a simple approach:If that number feels tight, start a little lower and promise yourself one thing: every time your income goes up, your savings rate will go up faster than your spending.At Value Research, when we build long-term plans, we don‚Äôt assume people will suddenly start saving 40% from next month. We assume they will start somewhere realistic, and then we design step-ups. The rigour is in the process, not in some magical starting number.One last point. Many people postpone investing because they are embarrassed by how small their starting amount looks. Please don‚Äôt underestimate the psychological power of seeing a small, growing pile that you started and maintained. It changes how you think about yourself: from ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt save‚Äù to ‚ÄúI am someone who always saves something.‚Äù That identity is worth more than one extra dinner out.So how much should you save and invest when your income feels just about enough? The honest answer is: start with whatever you can without lying to yourself, protect that amount like you protect your rent, and then make sure it rises every time your income increases. The ‚Äúright‚Äù number is not what a formula says; it‚Äôs the number you will actually stick to for the next 20 years.The perfect percentage can wait. The first rupee cannot.
Article Summary: Dhirendra Kumar: For most people, the problem is not which fund to choose. It‚Äôs how much they can realistically save when it feels like the money is just about enough. A good rule of thumb for many middle-class households is to allocate 20‚Äì30% of their take-home income.

In reality, the nominee is not always the final recipient ‚Äî the ownership rights belong to the legal heir, reported ET.Understanding the distinction between these two is essential to ensure that your wealth is passed on to the intended beneficiaries.A nominee acts as a temporary custodian of the deceased person‚Äôs assets.The nominee‚Äôs role is limited to holding and managing the assets until they are legally transferred to the rightful heirs.According to ET, the nominee cannot sell, trade, or make any transactional decisions about the assets.The account or policy owner can appoint anyone ‚Äî family, friends, or acquaintances ‚Äî as a nominee, though financial institutions often prefer close family members.In some cases, the nominee and the legal heir can be the same person, which helps in ensuring a smoother transfer of assets.The legal heir or beneficiary is the rightful owner of the assets once the original holder passes away.To claim ownership, the legal heir must produce valid documents such as a will or other testamentary proof.If there is no will ‚Äî a situation known as dying intestate ‚Äî the heir is determined as per the country‚Äôs succession or personal laws, reported ET.While a nominee can initially access the assets, only the legal heir can claim them permanently or challenge ownership in court.Experts quoted by ET emphasise that having clarity on this difference helps avoid disputes and ensures that the savings reach the intended family members or beneficiaries.Therefore, it is advisable to regularly update both nominees and wills to align with one‚Äôs estate planning goals.

Every year, lakhs of pensioners across India must prove that they are still alive to continue receiving their pension. However, with the government‚Äôs focus on digitisation and technological advancement, this process has become much simpler, faster, and more convenient. Pensioners can now submit their certificates digitally from the comfort of their homes using Jeevan Pramaan, a secure, user-friendly, and Aadhaar-based platform.A Life Certificate is an official document that confirms a pensioner is alive. Without it, pension payments are automatically paused by the pension disbursing agency. This verification is essential for preventing fraudulent claims and ensuring that pensions reach the rightful beneficiaries.The Digital Life Certificate (DLC), also known as Jeevan Pramaan, is an advanced biometric-enabled version of the traditional paper certificate.Introduced by the Government of India, it uses Aadhaar-based biometric authentication using either fingerprint or iris scan to verify a pensioner‚Äôs identity. Once verified, a digital certificate is automatically generated and shared with authorised pension disbursing agencies.This online process eliminates the need for physical verification, providing elderly pensioners with a simpler and more accessible way to maintain their pension benefits.According to PIB, The submission of the Life Certificate is mandatory for all pensioners who wish to continue receiving their pension without interruption. This extended window gives senior citizens more time and flexibility to complete the procedure without facing last-minute difficulties.The Jeevan Pramaan process involves two main steps: registering the biometric device and generating the digital certificate.Before using the service, pensioners or operators must register their biometric device such as a fingerprint or iris scanner. During registration, the user provides their Aadhaar number and mobile number, after which an OTP (One-Time Password) is sent to their mobile. After entering the OTP, they must provide their name and email ID before scanning their fingerprint or iris.Once authentication is complete, the system confirms that device registration was successful, allowing the user to move to the next step.In this step, the pensioner enters personal details such as Aadhaar number, mobile number, name, PPO number, pension type, sanctioning authority, disbursing agency, and bank account details. The system also asks whether the pensioner has remarried or is re-employed.After entering all details, the pensioner scans their fingerprint or iris using the registered biometric device. Upon successful authentication, the Digital Life Certificate is generated, and an SMS acknowledgment with the Jeevan Pramaan Certificate ID is sent to the registered mobile number.This certificate is automatically stored in the Life Certificate Repository, accessible anytime to both pensioners and pension agencies.Once the Digital Life Certificate is created, it can be electronically delivered to the concerned Pension Disbursing Agency (PDA). PDAs can log in to the Jeevan Pramaan portal to view, verify, or download the certificate directly.Pensioners can also download a PDF copy of their certificate by visiting the Jeevan Pramaan website and entering their Pramaan ID or Aadhaar number. This ensures transparency and easy access for future reference.The government provides several options to submit the Life Certificate, allowing pensioners to choose the method that suits them best.Pensioners who prefer traditional methods can visit their bank branch or a Citizen Service Centre (CSC) to submit their Life Certificate physically. Trained staff at these centres assist pensioners in verifying their details and completing the process.For those unable to travel due to age or health issues, India Post Payments Bank (IPPB) offers a doorstep banking service. Pensioners can schedule an appointment, and an IPPB representative will visit their home to complete the submission using biometric authentication. This service is available for both IPPB and non-IPPB account holders.For pensioners comfortable with technology, the Jeevan Pramaan portal provides a completely online process. By visiting https://jeevanpramaan.gov.in, pensioners can submit their Digital Life Certificate using a computer, laptop, or smartphone equipped with a fingerprint or iris scanner.The system uses the Aadhaar platform to authenticate biometric details. Once verification is successful, a Digital Life Certificate is generated and stored in a secure online repository. Pension disbursing agencies can then directly access the certificate, removing the need for physical paperwork.The UMANG (Unified Mobile Application for New-age Governance) app offers another easy option. Pensioners can download the app from the Google Play Store, search for ‚ÄúJeevan Pramaan,‚Äù and select ‚ÄúGenerate Life Certificate.‚ÄùAfter entering the necessary details such as Aadhaar number, PPO number, and type of pension, pensioners must authenticate themselves using biometric verification. The app then generates a Digital Life Certificate (DLC), which is automatically shared with the pension disbursing authority.All pensioners who receive government, defence, or private sector pensions through authorised disbursing agencies are required to submit their Life Certificate every year. The entire Jeevan Pramaan system is based on Aadhaar authentication, which ensures accuracy and prevents fraud. Pensioners must make sure their Aadhaar is linked with their mobile number and bank account before attempting to generate the certificate.The Digital Life Certificate is fully valid and legally recognised under the Information Technology Act. Pension disbursing authorities across India accept it as an official document, equivalent to the traditional paper-based life certificate.Its biometric verification system makes it secure and tamper-proof, reducing the chances of wrongful pension disbursal or misuse of pension funds.Before the introduction of Jeevan Pramaan, pensioners often faced difficulties in submitting their certificates, especially those with health problems or limited mobility. The digital system has removed these challenges, allowing pensioners to submit their verification anytime and anywhere.By integrating biometric technology and Aadhaar authentication, Jeevan Pramaan has streamlined pension management, improving efficiency for both pensioners and government departments. It also enhances transparency and ensures that genuine beneficiaries receive payments on time.

In India, hallmarking is governed by stringent standards outlined in IS 15820, according to an ET report.Hallmarking charges are applied per article, regardless of its weight. For gold articles, the charge is Rs 45 per article, with a minimum charge of Rs 200 for a consignment. Similarly, for silver articles, the charge is Rs 35 per article, with a minimum charge of Rs 150 for a consignment. It's important to note that additional taxes and levies may apply.A consignment refers to a collection of articles with the same fineness, from which a sample is drawn and assayed for compliance. Different lots may exist within a consignment.Anyone can have their hallmarked jewellery tested for purity at an A&H centre by paying a testing fee of Rs. 200 (for testing using the fire assay method as per IS 1418). These centres must be recognized by the BIS. The list of recognized A&H centres is available on the BIS website under the hallmarking section.The primary objective of hallmarking is to safeguard consumers from counterfeit products. To achieve this, the Indian government made hallmarking mandatory for gold jewellery from June 16, 2021. Since April 1, 2023, jewellers are prohibited from selling any gold jewellery without a 6-digit Hallmark Unique Identification ( HUID ) number.If you bought gold jewellery on or before June 30, 2021, it may have old hallmarking signs. These signs include the purity/fineness mark and the BIS emblem, along with two additional indications: the jeweller's identification number and the assay centre's mark/number.However, starting July 1, 2021, these two indications were replaced with a unique alphanumeric HUID code. The hallmark remains valid for the lifetime of the jewellery, and consumers can sell old jewellery, whether hallmarked or un-hallmarked, to jewellers.The HUID, or hallmark Unique Identification number, is a key component of hallmarking in gold jewellery. It's a unique six-digit alphanumeric code assigned to each hallmarked item, allowing for traceability. Customers can verify the HUID number using the 'Verify HUID' feature in the BIS Care App.Since the introduction of the HUID on July 1, 2021, the hallmark on gold jewellery consists of three marks: the BIS logo, the purity of the article in caratage and fineness, and a unique six-digit alphanumeric HUID number.
Article Summary: Hallmarking is the process of accurately determining and officially recording the proportionate content of precious metals in articles, such as gold and silver. In India, hallmarking is governed by stringent standards outlined in IS 15820. Since April 1, 2023, jewellers are prohibited from selling any gold jewellery without a 6-digit Hallmark Unique Identification number.

AI-related job cuts crossed 50,000 in 2025 in the US alone, according to new data from consulting firm Challenger, Gray & Christmas (via CNBC). A recent Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) study released in November also suggested that AI can handle 11.7% of U.S. jobs and could save companies $1.2 trillion in wages across finance, healthcare, and professional services.However, some experts question whether AI is the real reason for such widespread layoffs. Fabian Stephany, assistant professor of AI and work at the Oxford Internet Institute, told CNBC that many companies overhired during the pandemic and may now be using AI as a convenient ‚Äúexcuse‚Äù for downsizing.Despite the debate, many companies, including world‚Äôs biggest tech companies explicitly named AI as a reason for restructuring this year. Here we look at four big tech companies that called out AI in their job cuts announcementThe e-commerce giant laid off 14,000 corporate employees this year, one of its largest.Announcing the job cuts, Amazon‚Äôs senior vice president of people experience and technology, Beth Galetti said that the company is ‚Äòmaking organizational changes ‚Ä¶ which will include reducing in some areas and hiring in others‚Äô.‚ÄúThis generation of AI is the most transformative technology we‚Äôve seen since the Internet, and it's enabling companies to innovate much faster than ever before (in existing market segments and altogether new ones). We‚Äôre convinced that we need to be organized more leanly, with fewer layers and more ownership, to move as quickly as possible for our customers and business,‚Äù Galetti explained.Though days later at the company‚Äôs earnings call, Amazon CEO Andy Jassy explained ‚ÄúThe announcement that we made a few days ago was not really financially driven, and it's not even really AI-driven, not right now at least. It really ‚Äî it's culture‚Äù.Microsoft conducted at least four major rounds of workforce reduction, cutting around 15,000 jobs this year. Julia Liuson, president of Microsoft's Developer Division, then instructed managers that artificial intelligence usage "should be part of your holistic reflections on an individual's performance and impact." In internal emails, Liuson then declared that "using AI is no longer optional ‚Äî it's core to every role and every level".The company also said that it is considering adding formal AI usage metrics to performance reviews as it pushes for greater adoption of its Copilot AI services, adding some teams are exploring including specific AI usage benchmarks in next fiscal year's employee evaluations, according to sources familiar with the plans.In September, Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff confirmed that 4,000 customer support roles were cut with the help of AI automation. Benioff then said AI is already doing ‚Äúup to 50% of the work‚Äù at the company and that fewer staff are needed for many support functions. "But we now have an agentic sales that is calling back every person that contacts us."The company uses an "omnichannel supervisor" system that coordinates collaboration between human and AI agents, allowing AI to recognise when tasks require human intervention.In an interview with The Wall Street Journal, IBM CEO Arvind Krishna revealed that AI chatbots had replaced several hundred HR roles. Article Title: Government warns WhatsApp users about ‚ÄòGhostPairing‚Äô attack: What is it and how to stay safe
Article Text:
The WhatsApp Scam That Gives Hackers Your Phone!

What is GhostPairing

How to stay safe





The Indian computer emergency response team (CERT-In) has issued an advisory for WhatsApp users warning them of a ‚Äòdevice-linking‚Äô feature that can allow attackers to take ‚Äòcomplete‚Äô control of their account. The advisory, accessed by news agency PTI says that the vulnerability called ‚ÄòGhostPairing‚Äô put users‚Äô messages, photos, and videos on the web version at risk. ‚ÄúIt has been reported that malicious actors are exploiting WhatsApp's device-linking feature to hijack accounts using pairing codes without authentication requirement,‚Äù the cyber agency said in the advisory.‚ÄúThis newly identified cyber campaign called GhostPairing enable cyber criminals to take complete control of WhatsApp accounts without needing password or SIM swaps,‚Äù the advisory said.For those unaware, CERT-In is the national technology arm under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (Meity) to combat cyber attacks and guarding of the Indian Internet space.GhostPairing is a type of WhatsApp attack where hackers secretly link their own device to a victim‚Äôs WhatsApp account, giving them almost full access without the victim noticing. The attack works by tricking users into entering their phone number on a fake website that looks like Facebook or WhatsApp.According to the advisory, the scam usually starts with a message such as ‚ÄúHi, check this photo‚Äù that appears to come from a trusted contact. The message includes a link with a Facebook-style preview. When users click it, they are taken to a fake Facebook viewer page that asks them to ‚Äúverify‚Äù to see the content. At this stage, attackers exploit WhatsApp‚Äôs ‚Äúlink device via phone number‚Äù feature by convincing users to enter their number. Once they do, the attacker‚Äôs browser becomes a hidden, trusted device ‚Äî allowing them to take over the WhatsApp account.Once linked, attackers can read synced messages, receive new chats in real time, view photos, videos, and voice notes, and even send messages to the victim‚Äôs contacts and group chats.The advisory warns users not to click on suspicious links, even if they appear to come from known contacts, and to never enter their phone number on external websites claiming to be WhatsApp or Facebook.
Article Summary: GhostPairing is a type of WhatsApp attack where hackers secretly link their own device to a victim‚Äôs WhatsApp account, giving them almost full access without the victim noticing.
